record.description: Funerary vessels, ca. 500 B.C.E. Two large jars placed mouth to mouth to contain a body of which one jar has been broken away to reveal skeletal remains that were clothed in cloth and leather, and buried with grave goods. A joint University of Chicago-University of Pennsylvania expedition to the city of Nippur in Iraq discovered the burial beneath the living quarter of scribes.
record.publisher: University of Chicago Library, Special Collections Research Center
record.noteGeneral: Separate caption. PR stamps. 1685 deleted, duplicate of this record.
